author: Lisa Friedman and Maxine Joselow
description: The decision comes after a Supreme Court ruling allowing the Trump administration to slash the federal work force and dismantle agencies.
title: E.P.A. Says It Will Eliminate Its Scientific Research Arm

author: Emma G. Fitzsimmons and Lisa Lerer
description: No endorsement emerged from the meeting between Zohran Mamdani and Representative Hakeem Jeffries, but both said the gathering had been productive.
title: Mamdani Meets Jeffries in Brooklyn as He Seeks to Expand His Coalition

author: Benjamin Weiser and Luke Broadwater
description: The president has been under intense political pressure from his base after Attorney General Pam Bondi withheld portions of investigative files on the disgraced financier.
title: Justice Dept. Asks Manhattan Court to Unseal Epstein Grand Jury Testimony

author: John Koblin
description: CBS could not figure out a path to profitability in an entertainment world increasingly dominated by streaming.
title: Not Even ‘The Late Show’ Could Defy Gravity

author: Mark Walker and Neil Vigdor
description: Sunshine Stewart, 48, was found dead near 100 Acre Island after disappearing while paddle boarding in Union, Maine.
title: Teen Charged With Murder in Killing of Paddleboarder in Maine

author: Jeff Ernst, Ernesto Londoño and Mitch Smith
description: Nicole Mitchell, a Democrat, was charged with felonies and accused of breaking into her stepmother’s home. Her party holds a slim majority in the Minnesota Senate.
title: Minnesota State Senator Found Guilty in Burglary Trial

author: Molly Jong-Fast
description: Mocking Donald Trump will not destroy him.
title: Stephen Colbert Could Never Save Us From Trump

author: Karoun Demirjian
description: The administration is offering financial incentives to lure back recently departed immigration officers as it works to fill 10,000 job openings.
title: To Staff Trump’s Immigration Crackdown, ICE Entices Its Retirees

author: Derrick Bryson Taylor
description: With the hosts Merv Griffin, Pat Sajak, David Letterman and Stephen Colbert, CBS has taken many runs at late-night TV. Some were more successful than others.
title: A Brief History of CBS’s Late-Night Eras

author: Rebecca Robbins and Christina Jewett
description: Three patients with a muscle-wasting disease died from liver failure after taking the therapy, Ele­vidys, or a similar treatment.
title: FDA to Ask Sarepta to Stop Shipping Muscular Dystrophy Drug Elevidys

author: Tyler Pager
description: The president disputes reporting from The Wall Street Journal that he drew a picture for Jeffrey Epstein, but as a real estate mogul, he often sketched for charity.
title: In Response to Epstein Letter Report, Trump Says He Doesn’t ‘Draw Pictures’

author: Sarah Mervosh
description: The money will allow federally funded after-school programs to open this school year, preserving a lifeline for working parents. But other federal dollars remain on hold.
title: White House to Release $1.3 Billion in Frozen Funds for After-School Programs

author: Ashley Ahn
description: Paramount, the network’s parent, recently agreed to pay President Trump $16 million to settle his lawsuit over the editing of an interview on the CBS News program “60 Minutes.”
title: Lawmakers Question Whether CBS Canceled Colbert’s Show for Political Reasons

author: Rick Rojas, Margarita Birnbaum and David Montgomery
description: The Hill Country has a hold on the hearts of many Texans, meaning the suffering caused by the disaster is reaching as far as the region’s appeal.
title: After the Floods, a Pain So Vast It Makes Texas Feel Small

author: Mattathias Schwartz
description: After months of pushing back against federal judges and the courts, the president has requested the release of Epstein-related grand jury testimony to be “subject to Court approval.”
title: When It Comes to Jeffrey Epstein, Trump Says He Is Ready to Defer to the Courts

author: James Poniewozik
description: Maybe the “Late Show” decision is purely financial. But after Paramount’s cave over “60 Minutes,” it is hard to trust.
title: Why Is Stephen Colbert’s ‘Late Show’ Getting Canceled?

author: Jesus Jiménez and Ana Facio-Krajcer
description: It was not immediately clear what caused the blast, at the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department’s Biscailuz Training center.
title: 3 Deputies Are Killed in Explosion at Los Angeles Training Center

author: Alan Rappeport
description: The National Capital Planning Commission has become pivotal in the administration’s campaign to discredit Jerome H. Powell, the chairman of the Federal Reserve.
title: Trump’s War With Powell Throws a Little-Known Planning Board Into Scrutiny

author: Brian Seibert and Vincent Tullo
description: To celebrate the shows’ golden anniversaries, the Broadway star Robyn Hurder demonstrates what makes their choreography so special.
title: The Moves That Make ‘Chicago’ and ‘A Chorus Line’ So Special

author: Colby Smith
description: The central bank is poised to hold interest rates steady this month, but there could be a path to cut as early as September.
title: Trump’s Withering Criticism of Powell Puts Fed Decisions Under Microscope

author: Anita Gates
description: With his wife, Marilyn, he wrote the words to memorable TV theme songs and the Oscar-winning “The Way We Were” and “The Windmills of Your Mind.”
title: Alan Bergman, Half of a Prolific Lyric-Writing Team, Dies at 99

author: ‘The Ezra Klein Show’
description: The conspiracy theories around Jeffrey Epstein hit at the very core of the MAGA worldview. That’s why they’ve caused so much infighting on the right, argues columnist Ezra Klein on The Ezra Klein Show.
title: Why Trump Can’t Shake Jeffrey Epstein

author: Meghan O’Rourke
description: We need to reckon with what ChatGPT is doing to the classroom and to human expression.
title: The Seductions of A.I. for the Writer’s Mind

author: Kevin Draper
description: President Trump’s plan to impose a 100 percent tariff on Russian goods could raise the cost of urea, a key fertilizer in corn and other row crops.
title: Tariffs on Russia Could Hurt Wary U.S. Farmers

author: Evan Gorelick
description: We examine the voting age around the world.
title: Should Teens Vote?

author: Rebecca F. Elliott
description: An arbitrator cleared the way for Chevron to buy Hess, allowing the energy giant to acquire a piece of one of the most promising oil projects in the world.
title: Chevron Wins Green Light to Buy Into One of World’s Hottest Oil Projects

author: Tracy Mumford, Will Jarvis, Ian Stewart and Jessica Metzger
description: Plus, your Friday news quiz.
title: Trump’s New Order on Epstein Files, and Colbert’s Canceled ‘Late Show’

author: Kenneth P. Vogel
description: Recent comments by the Israeli prime minister and a Fox News commentator about their suburban Philadelphia high school have inflamed a debate.
title: Debate Ignites at U.S. School Over Netanyahu’s Hall of Fame Status

author: Michelle Goldberg
description: From the director of “Midsommar,” a nightmare vision of our national descent.
title: A Movie About the Year America Went Fully Berserk

author: Jim Rutenberg
description: The cuts speak to President Trump’s grip on his party but also to the sweeping changes in media.
title: NPR and PBS Funding Cuts Were Decades in the Making

author: Kevin Draper
description: President Trump’s plan to impose a 100 percent tariff on Russian goods could raise the cost of urea, a key fertilizer in corn and other row crops.
title: Tariffs on Russia Could Hurt Wary U.S. Farmers

author: Jonathan Rauch and Peter Wehner
description: The party is getting pummeled. But it can fight back.
title: ‘Democrats Don’t Need to Become G.O.P. Lite’

author: Alex Travelli
description: President Trump’s attacks on the group of emerging economies, which includes Brazil, Russia and China, have put one member — India — in an uncomfortable spot.
title: One of These BRICS Is Not Like the Others

author: Alan Blinder, Michael S. Schmidt and Michael C. Bender
description: President Trump suggested a deal was coming, but officials are still demanding more from Harvard, including extensive information about international students, staff payroll and protests.
title: As Harvard and Trump Head to Court, the Government Piles on the Pressure

author: Alan Blinder, Michael S. Schmidt and Michael C. Bender
description: President Trump suggested a deal was coming, but officials are still demanding more from Harvard, including extensive information about international students, staff payroll and protests.
title: As Harvard and Trump Head to Court, the Government Piles on the Pressure

author: Jesse Green
description: The slinky jailbirds and Broadway hopefuls in these two classic shows have been fighting it out since 1975.
title: ‘A Chorus Line’ and ‘Chicago’ at 50: Who Won?

author: Ron Lieber and Benjamin Mueller
description: The start-up, called Truemed, helps people buy meat and mattresses with money that isn’t subject to federal income tax. But does the tax break apply?
title: Truemed, a Start-Up Run by an RFK. Jr. Aide, Gives Tax Breaks for Meat and Mattresses

author: Sarah Kliff
description: Offering a rare glimpse inside the hidden world of rejected insurance claims, new data shows a steady uptick among major private insurers.
title: Heath Insurers Are Denying More Drug Claims, Data Shows

author: Santul Nerkar and Jonah E. Bromwich
description: In Manhattan, Brooklyn, Albany and Newark, confusion has reigned as prosecutors are fired or walk out, and U.S. attorneys serve in limbo while awaiting confirmation.
title: Trump-Driven Chaos Comes to U.S. Attorney’s Offices in Waves

author: Trish Bendix
description: CBS “will be ending ‘The Late Show’ in May,” Colbert told his audience on Thursday. He kept the announcement brief and light.
title: Stephen Colbert Laments the End of ‘The Late Show’ on CBS

author: Benjamin Mullin, Claire Hogan, Leila Medina and Laura Salaberry
description: Congress just voted to claw back $500 million in funding for public broadcasting. Benjamin Mullin, a media reporter for The New York Times, explains what will happen now to NPR, PBS and the many local stations that rely on the funding.
title: The Impact of Defunding NPR and PBS

author: Alex Marshall
description: Nicholas McCarthy overcame rejection to make a professional career playing the surprisingly vast repertoire for left-hand piano.
title: Only 5 Fingers Playing Piano, but the Sound of So Many Hands

author: Alexandra Stevenson, Hasya Nindita and Ulet Ifansasti
description: Long before President Trump wielded tariffs as a weapon to punish Indonesia, the country was fighting back a flood of cheap Chinese goods.
title: Before Trump, Indonesia Had Another Trade Headache: China

author: Glenn Thrush
description: The attorney general plans to ask a court to release the papers. But even if the request succeeds, it would fall far short of critics’ demands to release all investigative materials.
title: Trump Tells Bondi to Seek Release of Epstein Grand Jury Testimony

author: Eric Schmitt and Julian E. Barnes
description: The alert, issued to retired service members who served in Iraq or Syria and live in Florida, did not specify what kind of threat or which terrorist group was involved.
title: Army Special Operations Warns Retired Members of Terror Threat

author: Ezra Klein
description: The journalist Will Sommer examines the perfect storm of the Epstein files, Trump, QAnon and MAGA.
title: Why Trump Can’t Shake Jeffrey Epstein

author: Michael Gold
description: The House Rules Committee laid the groundwork for an eventual vote to call for release of the Epstein files, reflecting Republican uneasiness with the president’s refusal to divulge information from the investigation.
title: House Republicans Dangle Possible Vote on Epstein Files, After Voter Backlash

author: Hannah Ziegler and Alexandra E. Petri
description: Many questioned the timing of and motivation for the announcement, noting that Mr. Colbert hosted the most-watched show in late night television.
title: Fans React to Colbert ‘Late Show’ Cancellation With Puzzlement and Anger

author: Laurel Rosenhall
description: Gov. Gavin Newsom says California should redraw its own congressional districts if Texas tries to gerrymander its lines. His idea faces long odds.
title: Newsom Wants California to Counter Texas on Redistricting

author: Luke Broadwater
description: Donald Trump was friendly for at least 15 years with Jeffrey Epstein, the multimillionaire financier and convicted sex offender who died in prison in 2019.
title: A Timeline of What We Know About Trump and Epstein

author: Michael C. Bender and Sharon Otterman
description: A deal to resolve allegations that the university failed to protect Jewish students from harassment is expected to include a fine of about $200 million.
title: Columbia and White House Enter Final Stage of Talks to End Standoff
